intro: Sida salzmannii, commonly known as Salzmann's cotton, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa, the Middle East, and South Asia. It is an annual herb that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring hairy stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, followed by fluffy, white seed capsules resembling cotton. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Sida salzmannii is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
